actions: Strongly tonifies Yuan Qi, warms and nourishes acquired Qi, strengthens the Spleen and Stomach, generates Fluids, benefits Heart Qi and calms the Shen.
(Tonifies the Spleen, augments Qi, nourishes Blood and calms the Shen.)

syndromes: Phlegm Obstructs the Heart Orifice: Exhaustion Syndrome
Qi Collapse after severe loss of Blood

contraindications: Used more for acquired Qi problems or milder Yuan Qi problems.

notes: Not as warming as Shen Fu Tang.
